title: David Icke - The Master Collection (Audio)
description:
________________________________________________________________________

More than 44 hours of David Icke lectures spanning fourteen years.

From 1994 to 2008.

1994 xx xx [The Robots Rebellion]
1996 xx xx [Turning of the Tide]
1999.12.xx [Ruled by the Gods]
2003.06.xx [Secrets of the Matrix]
2004.02.24 [Freedom Road]
2005-07-23 [Live at Mount Shasta]
2006-05-06 [Freedom or Fascism]
2008-07-06 [Big Brother the Big Picture]
2008-07-14 [Oxford Union]
2008-09-xx [Beyond the Cutting Edge]

This collection does not include the Arizona Wilder interview or the
Credo Mutwa "Reptilian Agenda" interview. Other official releases
might not be here, just let me know (post a comment on TPB if you
know of any other official or unofficial video of David Icke talking
and I might reseed a new collection) 

This collection is is meant to be David Icke on his own, just his info.

Also if you can fill in any of the "xx" dates it would be appreciated.

Maybe one of the most amazing finds in all these files was in Robots
Rebellion back in 1994 where David Icke tells us that John Kerry (then
a Governor) is a member of the Skull & Bones sociey. This was more than
ten whole years before people like Alex Jones eventually told us!

________________________________________________________________________

All files are:

FORMAT: | .MP3 |
BITRATE: | 32kbps | 22,050Hz/24,000Hz | 16-bit | Mono |
DURATION: | Varied |

________________________________________________________________________

All fit easily onto a standard 700Mb CD for MP3 players.

In fact these will easily fit onto an ancient 650Mb CD.

If you are burning these to CD you should run this file:

"Create a CD folder.bat"

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
DO NOT RUN THIS FILE IF YOU ARE DOWNLOADING THIS COLLECTION AS A TORRENT!
WAIT FOR THE TORRENT TO COMPLETELY FINISH DOWNLOADING!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you run this file "Create a CD folder.bat" it will copy all the
David Icke lectures to a new folder simply called "CD" and once it
has finished, will leave you with a nice easy managable folder full
of MP3's that will be compatible on all MP3 capable CD players.

This file "Create a CD folder.bat" does all the hard work for you!

No need to go through renaming all the files to 8.3 standards. Once
you have created the CD folder and it has all 28 files named as
00000001.MP3 and so on up to 00000028.MP3 you can than simply burn
those files (not the CD folder, the actual files themselves) onto
a CD for playback on MP3 players that take CD's.

These lectures will all be in the exact same order as the original
files, so the file "00000001.MP3" will be "The Robots Rebellion"
then "00000002.MP3" will be "Turning of the Tide" and so on.

I know from stupid MP3 players in the past, some CD-MP3 players
will not be able to "see" inside folders on the CD, but they will
always be able to play the files as long as the files are there
on the CD as soon as you open the CD.

Some MP3 players will refuse to play a file that is longer than
8 characters, especially older MP3 players.

For example the first file in this collection:

[The-Robots-Rebellion]-[Neptune-Theatre]-[Liverpool]-[England]

Has a massive long file name as do all the files, if you run the
included .bat file then this MP3 would be copied and renamed to:

00000001.MP3

________________________________________________________________________

These files are at such a low bitrate in order to fit them all onto
one single CD. Because these lectures have no music, the clarity is
quite unimportant and David Icke's voice is perfectly clear, even at
just 32kbps and in mono.

It equates to you getting 60:00 minutes of audio for just 13.7 MB
of disk space!

Most of these MP3's came from video's that also have a slideshow
presentation.

In parts David Icke points to the slides and with these MP3's you cannot
see this, for the best experience you should buy David Icke DVD's to
support him. I personally think the guy has risked a lot and busted his
ass to bring this kind of info to everyone's attention - consistently.
He should get all the financial support possible. He is extremely
intelligent and most of the time his DVD's just get pirated - this MP3
package gives you all the audio, but none of the video. David Icke never
officially released MP3's like this and all audio is ripped from the
video's whether they are DVD or public domain.

I also think though, that this info is NOT entertainment and that we
all have a right to at least hear it, without being called "pirates".

Considering that David Icke exposes many crimes of the elites, this is
a matter of public concern, its not Metallica folks, its serious.

Hopefully these MP3's can bring attention to David Icke and maybe some
donations or DVD sales that he would not have otherwise had.

________________________________________________________________________
